entities.name: snape
entities.description: Snape is mentioned as someone who held Harry up and prevented him from getting to somewhere on time. ("If Snape hadn’t held me up,")

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character of the story and is having a conversation with Ron about what might have happened if Snape had not held him up.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is Harry’s friend and is participating in the conversation about what might have happened if Snape had not held Harry up.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is mentioned as someone who wants to see Professor Moody to find out whether he found Mr. Crouch.

entities.name: moody
entities.description: Professor Moody is a person that Hermione wants to see in order to find out if he found Mr. Crouch.

entities.name: crouch
entities.description: Mr. Crouch is someone who Professor Moody might have found, according to Hermione’s statement.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as someone who was with Harry and might have been able to get down to the forest faster than Snape.

relationships.description: Snape held Harry up, preventing him from getting somewhere on time.
Ron is supporting Harry in his conversation about what might have happened if Snape had not held him up.
Hermione wants to see Professor Moody to find out whether he found Mr. Crouch.
Harry and Ron are discussing how fast Dumbledore might have been able to get down to the forest compared to Snape.
